properties.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 11:08AM MST until February 5 at 8:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Winter storm continues for the Sacramento Mountains and will
spread to much of the other lowlands east of the Rio Grande Valley
tonight. Some moderate to heavy snow is currently falling over the
Sacramento Mountains and should continue into Wednesday morning.
The east slopes and central portion of the mountains are expected
to receive the heaviest snowfall as low level east flow increases
throughout tonight. Elsewhere some rain showers will continue
across the lowlands east of the Rio Grande Valley through early
this evening. This rain will turn to snow by late evening as low
level east flow increases. Some snow accumulation is expected
across Hudspeth County and the lowlands of Otero County. The snow
should taper off and end by around noon on Wednesday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Up to 2 inches of snow has already fallen
this morning, and additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches
are expected.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations 4 to 8 inches likely,
with up to 10 inches over higher elevations.

* WHERE...East slopes and central portion of Sacramento Mtns.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING...Occasional moderate to heavy snow this afternoon; more
frequent heavy snow overnight. Snow tapering off and ending by
noon time Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Some roads could
become impassable and/or closed. The cold wind chills as low as
zero to 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions
are not taken.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY
